title: Adhai Din ka Jhopra
review: ute from Dargah to Ana Sagar vice versa. The average spent time is 1 hour. It is believed that this mosque was constructed in just two and half days. There used to be a Sanskrit college which was demolished by Mohammad ghori and this mosque was constructed in 1198 a.d.

title: What a disappointment
review: Please don't follow up the pictures. Like a hundred others, this one is a historic property in a pathetic condition. Garbage, strays and beggers will really spoil your vacay mood.

title: Useless
review: Total waste of time , energy and money, It is garbage and pig house, no maintenance, originally it was very old Vedic Sanskrit education center, mugal rules converted it in mosque.

title: The reminder of the times !
review: This iconic place of Ajmer is a constant reminder of the fragility of life . This beautiful monument is witness to the history and its legacy during the times when the decisions were made to complete it in two and half day . The up keep is very poor looking at the heritage it represents . The access is too poor - not many people come here . This beautiful monument is located  in the not too good location - very poor and unkempt neighborhood . But , this beautiful site unravels the magnificent era of the times . Worth the trouble to come to discover it .

title: Beautuful place
review: Its a nice place to be. You need to walk for 5 mins from the ajmer dargah to reach here. On your way you will get a lot of food stals. Place is a bit old but a ice one to click some fine pictures. No entry fee needed here.

title: OLD MONUMENT FOR GOOD PHOTOS
review: I have visited this place today , situated near by Dargah, Its an old monument but looks beautiful . 1 of the best place in ajmer to visit for picnic or photography.

title: Heritage in Shambles
review: Real piece of Indian Heritage in the heart of Ajmer Town is in state of total disregard and disrespect. It needs immediate attentions by the keepers.

title: Exquisite
review: One of the first monuments of the medieval age, this was the main attraction for me in Ajmer. I spent my time exploring every corner, every pillar and the extraordinary architecture of the place. Numerous apocryphal tales abound, with practically all local faiths staking claim to this mosque, but viewing it as a classical blend of Info Islamic architecture is also adequate to give you goosebumps. Designed in a perfect square, with tall ornate gates, marble mihraab and the screens that predates the domes that have come to be associated with mosques Dhai din ka Jhopda is located at a five minute walk from Dargah Sharif. Pillars bear intricate design, in testimony to the master craftsmen from 9 centuries ago. The place is steeped in history, and is a must visit gor lovers of architecture and history. An excellent place for photography too

title: Interesting place to visit
review: This Moslem mosque is a little out of town of Ajmer, and cars cannot access the route to the mosque. You need to take a tuktuk. Lots of dark red stone pillars and domes covered in Arabic writing. It was lovely to see the people worshiping at this very old mosque.  Many people sitting around in the stoney courtyard.

title: A place with Beautiful architecture
review: As the story goes this place was build within 2 and half days. but even today's technology it will take years to make. Beautiful carved walls and pillars.

title: nice place
review: it is a mosque in ajmer and very near to sharif dargah ..here u can see lots of foreigner and it is very beautifully constructed by aibak ..we spend here 2 hr and i feel happy bcoz i luv historical place

title: Family fun
review: The most amazing place heritage to visit so many pillar creat in two and half days  this amazing to see this beautiful place ,

title: Sacred place
review: A very sacred place in rajasthan ...  a good place to visit ... cow meat was available which is literally not tolerable ...

title: Great...
review: Such a great place to watch. Great atmosphere, design and Architecture are great. It is a gem of Ajmer.

title: Great art of work neglected by caretakers
review: Adai din ka jhopda is the remains of one of the best archeological work by mugal era.

title: Waste of Time and Effort
review: This place is not so great and it is neglected and maintained very badly. The access to this place is through a very narrow market road and is very crowded and dirty. Nothing you will lose if u miss this one..

title: Only importance is it that it is historical otherwise no more attraction-
review: Dhai din ka jhonpra aur Adhai din ka jhonpra is actually a mosque and it is said that it was built after destruction of a sanskrit school there ,it is also said that it was built in 2 and half days only so it is called dhai-din ka jhonpra or A dhai-din ka jhonpra means a hut made in two and half days,it was built about 800 years ago by then muslim rulers,no much attraction but important only from the angle of history---thanks---SSS---

title: The monument made in two and half days !
review: The story related to this historic spot is known to most that it was built in two and half days . Away for the Dargah this place is not in a good state . Located in the midst of the dirt road and congested area of housing , The structure is eye catching reflecting the history .The Arabic writing on the walls and on the top of the entrance brings back the glory days of the Muslim reign here . No entree fee . Not safe area in late evenings .,

title: 2 AND HALF DAY SLUM
review: Adhai-din ka jhonpra mosque is made during mugal rules best structure explain the indian history this place is good to see its 10 to 15 min away form ajmer dargah sarif

title: Needs to be maintained a lot more
review: Good place to visit and see the architecture as to how the fort was planned to be built but had to be left as you can see. It was built in only 2 and half days. This is worth a visit but this place needs to be maintained.

title: Best architecture
review: This place is having a interesting story.. which will increase ur adrenaline level... and make u suprise ..

title: picturistic places with great architecture
review: Think one of the best place. Take a Auto for Rs.180, he will take you through narrow lanes of Muslim place with all the eateries (just see do not eat). The place has great architecture, designs  and very photogenic place. Work a visit.

title: Its the one of the best Heritage site
review: I like this place very much . And I heard many stories about this place. And this is the good place for namaz also

title: will remind you the qutab minar
review: It’s something like ruins of some ancient mosque. The place will remind you of the ruins of the mosque near the Qutab Minar in Delhi. All the walls there are filled with beautiful carvings, which are nice to see. The place is at a walkable distance from the dargah of Khwajah

title: Family fun
review: The most amazing place heritage to visit so many pillar creat in two and half days this amazing to see this beautiful place

title: Classic Monument of Art
review: It’s a very beautiful place. If you’re visiting Ajmer visit this place. It is said that the monument was built in within 60 hours.

title: It is a Sanskrit school in past
review: It is a Sanskrit school in past when Alaudin ruled over Ajmer he turned it mosque in two & half day so it is known dhai din ka jhopda

title: a hidden place
review: hidden in the streets of Ajmer, this place is a historical excerpt hidden. visit is a must if you wish to know more about the history of Rajasthan.

title: Historical place
review: It is one of historical place in Ajmer.  But it is not worth the effort as place is accessible by foot only from Ajmer Dargah. But it is less than 1km from Dargah.

title: Mosque
review: Another mosque built nearby the dargah sharif.

title: Nice building built in 2 and half days
review: Adhai din ka jhopara is nice Islamic building. This building is built-in 2 and half days .nice place for tourists visit.

title: Old architect
review: Very old palace walking distance from Dangah sheriff.  You can visit there just for history nothing else.

title: Adhai din ka jhopda
review: It is a historical place in ajmer it is near to dargah sharif only 1 or 2 km from ajmer dargah sharif..

title: A historical building from the 11th century
review: It is a good historical building, joining the dots for those who have visited Qutab Minar in New Delhi. The neglect by Archeological Survey of India is appalling.

title: Full of fun with this place
review: On March all of my best friends visited ajmer Sharif and we have enjoyed a lot at that place .

title: Adhai Din Ka jhopda
review: Adhai Din Ka jhopda of Ajmer is wonderful historical building. This building was built in Mughal Era.

title: Adhai Din Ka jhopda
review: Adhai Din Ka jhopda is a famous tourist spot in Ajmer district of Rajasthan as it was built in Mughal Era.It is just near the Ajmer Sharif Dargah approx 5 min. by walking.

title: Must go
review: This is very exotic place. Each and every wall carved speaks about the sculpture and architecture. Really built beautifully. This is very ancient dhai din ki masjid. You must really prefer if you love those wall art.

title: Beautifully built up
review: It’s a wonderful historic place. It was built in just 2.5 days.

title: An old mosque.. can be skipped if paucity of time

title: Heritage property going wasted
review: Place is very poorly managed. Approach road is narrow and filthy. In monsoon with rain comes all the sewage and waste from nearby shops selling what-not!

title: Beautiful Historical place
review: This is wonderful Historical place of Ajmer. It is very attractive for tourist. Its architecture is amazing. This is mugal architecture example.must visit there

title: An old mosque converted from a temple (Skip if pressed for time)
review: This place is walkable from Ajmer dargah shariff. The walls have lot of arabic inscription. If you are on a tight schedule, skip this place, not worth the time.

title: Impossible to reach

title: Really historic place for all, can see mix of Hindu as well as muslim architecture

title: Not Worth A visit
review: This place is just a remainings of an old era. Neither it is maintained properly, and all around you see is people,  and animals tied. Even there is no proper way to go there fromcar.

title: Fantastically built place.
review: A must see purely for the aura created by the enclosure. A commendable feat achieved in 2.5 days. Crowded by tourists now a days, but listening to Sufi songs via headphones is a cherry on the cake,

review: very old masjid near to Dargah Sarif . you will know about old Muslim Architecture . this big masjid and anyone can see

title: Built in 2½ days
review: Beyond the Dargah of Khwaja Muin-ud-din Chishti, on the town outskirts, are the extraordinary ruins of the Adhai-din-ka-Jhonpra mosque. According to legend, construction in 1153 took only 2½ days. Others say it was named after a festival lasting 2½ days.

title: Heritage Mosque
review: An example of early Indo-islamic architecture,the mosque was designed by Abu Bakr of Herat.People can enter the mosque from the gateway in the north.A number of small arches built of yellow limestone adorn the front facade of the mosque.

title: regional place
review: Great exprience. monument build within 2.5 days through which the name has been give to this fantastic monument.

title: you will love it, when you vist it
review: this is the most under-rated place of ajmer i think, because most people came to ajmer to visit dargah sharif only. this place is at walking distance from  dargah sharif. while exit from dargah take left turn and walk through the local market toward adhai din ka jhopra. while walking you will enjoy the rajasthani cultural taste. adhai din ka jhopra is at height and you have to climb through stairs to reach. its wonderful ancient built place which was made in only 2 and half days.... you will surely say "unbelievable " and this what your are here for. but this place is dirty, smelly, and also unhygienic (sorry). its a little unsafe for single couple. but in group of friends and with family its worth of visiting. it is a less known wonder of ajmer

title: A very hisyoric place
review: As we visited with friends as nearly half km from dargah sharif with historic masjid there is only a masjid with old structure but if you are going to ajmer you must visit there and you can see the historic stones masjid and more......

title: One of the oldest in India
review: This mosque is one of the oldest in India and  an early example of blending  of the elements of Hindu and Islamic architecture. This is not surprising - it stands on the site of Jain Sanskrit College, and most likely of the temple attached to it. Much for the construction of the mosque was "borrowed" from the Jain and Hindu shrines. For example, three hundred columns, somewhat similar to those which are found in the cave temples. Now only about five dozen of them still standing in their places. The fact that the mosque was built in two and a half days is no more than usual legend. Most likely, during this time, the builders managed to supply only the entrance gate with arched doorway and adjacent smaller arches from both sides, in order to arrange a place for prayer.

title: Nice
review: Nearly 10 minutes walking distance from The Dargah Shariff is located The adhai din ka jhopda.

title: A must visit for the stroy around it.
review: This is a mosque with its own history. Its at a walking distance from the Dargah. This place is surrounded by market. A quite huge and mosque.

title: The lobour of the faith !
review: This place takes you back to the time when the sacred was revered and as an example this pkac was done in 2/1-2 days as a testimony of the faith .located within the city but , not too popular with the tourists - generally not crowded. No entry fee .

title: Amazing!
review: This is made in the time of Hazrat Syed Khwadja Gareeb nawaaz. On his command Djins made this in a cpuple of days. Haq Moin!

title: Good Arctacture
review: Well designe and completely agree in 2&half day how it would be made . but good and very near to Dargha shariff

title: CALM
review: Nice place a part of ancient history you will feel amazed

title: General Manager
review: Adhai-Din-Ka-Jhonpra is one of the oldest mosque in India and the oldest surviving monument.

title: Historical place
review: adhai din ka jhopdi is the important tourist visit place in ajmer..the architecture was fabulous..when you look up in the mosque  the architecture design is different from each other..

title: Wonders of indoislamic architechture
review: Wonders of indoislamic architechture,it was built in 2 and half day.the place is very beautiful but only problem is reaching the place its in hights and required lots of walking.

title: 12th century?
review: To me it looks like old mosque not maintained well.

title: Ancient  mosque
review: This is ancient  mosque built many years back. Walking distance from khawaja garib nawaz darga. One must visit.

title: Could have been better
review: Since this is an active mosque and access to the site is not very easy, I would rate it as average. One needs to pass through a congested market, full of beggars. Inside the monument, you won't find proper cleanliness that a religious site should have.

title: waste of Time
review: Adhai-din ka Jhonpra Mosque was built in 2 and half day. the place is very beautiful but only problem is reaching the place its in hights and required lots of walking.

title: An Old structure or monument
review: This monument is located near to Dargah Sharif,  Walking distance Of 500mtrs only, going through the market. Area looks like ruins and not that much clean. If you are visiting Dargah and have 15- 20 minutes in  spare. You may plan to visit.

title: dhai-din ka Jhonpra ajmer
review: Beautiful historic place. Adhai Din Ka Jhonpra is a mosque in the Ajmer city of Rajasthan, India. Thanks

title: One of the Oldest Mosques
review: Just a 10 min walk from the Dargah Sharif is Adhai-Din-Ka-Jhonpra which is a mosque built by Qutbuddin Aibak in 1200 making it one of India's oldest mosques. It is named so because it was supposedly constructed in two and a half days (adhai din). It was built by demolishing a Jain Sanskrit learning centre and by using major portions of the already existing structure. One can clearly make out that the outer facade with massive arches and Quranic inscriptions was a later addition to the main structure which has Hindu-Jain architecture.

title: Ruined beautiful place
review: If you don’t have any plan after visiting the Dargah then this is the place.Walking distance from Dargah.Ask any person outside the dargah and he/she will guide you here.30 steps to climb and there is an open area.Though it is a small monument and ruined, but whatever is there is attractive.An open place and requires 10 to 15 minutes to cover.

title: Place Build in two and half day
review: Near to dargah its the the place got ruins of excellent building at one time. Debatable place about the temple or college before mosque.

title: Massive but dirty
review: If you stay close by, I would recommend that you walk to this place. This is in the market area. You can use Google maps as a guide. The streets are narrow, do not let that scare you. Keep walking, the streets seemed interesting and safe. Surely dirty but safe.

title: this is an archietecural masterpiece
review: Loved this Place.If you visit dargah this place is few meters away from the Dargah.

title: Marvellous architecture, though the whole thing is in a bit dilapidated state
review: Multiple stories behind the origin of the structure.

title: Place near to KGN Dargah Sharif
review: The mosque is among the earliest examples of the Indo-Islamic architecture. Very close from Dargah Sharif, 5 mins walk away. One should visit and see the architecture of this mosque.

title: The Second Interesting Place after Dargah
review: This Place has got some history in the backdrop which is debatable. The large structure is placed in the midst of locality not far from the Dargah in a walking distance. Maintained by ASI and needs some attention on cleanliness.

title: A look at Adhai-din-ka-Jhopra
review: This monument is situated just 300 meters off Dargah Shariff in Ajmer. Yet it takes more than half hour to reach it because of the narrow road lined with shops jutting out, traffic , sheer number of people visiting and of course the pigs, goats, cows and dogs.

title: Feel the History
review: When you visit this place sure you will attract towards the history more that your current attraction may this place will make you passionate about history, keep trying

title: “Historical Place”
review: A Historically important place. This is a masterpiece of Indo-Islamic Architecture located just beyond the Dargah..

title: Great place
review: Its a very nice place, protected by ASI, beautiful architecture, intricate designs and very picturesque. Special thing is its said to be built in two and a half days by jinns, hence this name.

title: Ruins built by the wanderers
review: It's a beautiful structure with beautiful carvings on the pillars of the structure which supports the roof. It's just a ruins that's few meters away from the main Dargah. You can spend maximum 20 mins admiring the carvings on them.

title: A remarkable structure
review: This is a masterpiece of Indo-Islamic Architecture located just beyond the Dargah.

title: OK
review: We went to this place in the evening when it was closed but a person came from inside and opened the door and said you can only enter if you want to offer namaz. really didn't understood the logic. but at normal timings when this place is open, people suggested that it is really worth a visit (and can go even if you do not know to offer namaz). it's said that this place was built in 2.5 days and hence its name.

title: Place of historic importance, but ruined and invaded by unauthorized vendors.
review: Not worth more than 5 minutes. You will find stray animals, beggars invading the place. You will have to come here on foot as taking a car here is almost impossible. You have come to Dargah, you can see this place. Another unfortunate example of inefficient, irresponsible tourism department of Rajasthan. Could be a place to cherish though if maintained.

title: Historical Place
review: here you can attend your namaz and this is the best place to visit and really a historical place....

title: You may skip a visit
review: Although a historically important place and good in an architect's point of view, the place is not worth a visit. The location is terrible. You have to cross narrow, over-crowded, filthy lanes to reach the spot. If you are visiting Dargah Shariff, then visit the ruin, the two being just 10 minutes walk apart.

title: Touchy men with little self control
review: My girlfriend was constantly being harassed by young men in this area, trying to touch her etc. We have been in India for over a month now (previously also) and this is the only place she has felt uncomfortable.

title: Not bad
review: Visited this while trekking down from Taragarh. Adhai din as the title suggests, it was constructed in two and a half days

title: Good place but not maintained
review: This seems the hindu temple as per my observation, as you see the pillers have hindu godesses which was delibrately damaged. nice decorative place, the place not at all maintained. children urinating, goats are roaming all around. dirty as well. if this place would have maintained very well then it would be great to see attraction.

title: Amazing Structure.
review: It is believed that this magnificent structure was built in Adhai din and that is how its name is derived.

title: landmark of ajmer
review: Its a historic place in ajmer and shud be on ur must see list. D mosque is really old . If ur a history buff thn ul love this place. Sufi marvel.

title: Peaceful Place
review: Instead of taking an auto, I walked to this Adhai Din ka Jhonpra through the serpentine land. Aroma of mouth watering dishes filled the air and so did the loud voices of the shopkeepers. The lane was crowded with people, some strolling in the evening, some out for shopping, some selling. And then it was all quite, from a narrow lane, I was in a vast open area and in front of me was this beautiful structure. I am no expert but it seems that this monument was built in hurry using stones from previous ruins. I could mark few stones with pre Islamic architecture. Not sure, if there were Hindu or Jain structure, But it seemed the person who used these stones in pillars, just inserted them without thinking much about matching the style. Anyway, the place was lot cooler, than the surrounding and the structure created atmosphere of calmness in midst of din and crowd.

title: Adhai-din ka Jhonpra
review: Good to see Artitectural work.This is a Mosque basically. the excellence is sound amplifying system made in those days without having any Loud speaker system like today. Stones are arranged in such a way that amplifies the sound. Azaan being given at a particular place at a particular position is being listned in the surrounding. Excellent Engineering in ancient era.

title: great building
review: This mosque, built from the dismantled remains of temples, is known as Adhai-din-ka-Jhonpra possibly from the fact that a fair used to be held here for two and a half days.here govt should pay more attention towards this building and shold improve tourism

title: "Good place"
review: Adhai din ka Jhopda in Ajmer is supposedly, a place of worship for the Hindu and Jain culture before a mosque was built out of the temple ruins.

title: The under mined ladmarks of Ajmer
review: This attraction consists of the beautiful monument to the history of Ajmer . An experience of the Mughal era and its shining example of the unusual architecture displayed for the people who have a love for history . A good guide needed . Since the approach is little difficult it is advisable to hire a knowledgable guide from the city - to save you time .

title: Beautiful but uncared for
review: Basically a mosque within walking distance of Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti Dargah.  An example of architectural excellence.  The construction amplifies sound and the stone carving is beautiful.

title: Historical arts
review: Adhai din ka Jhonpra Mosque, its construction and architecture is age old history I like to visit such a place but the house keeping nearby the lawn is very poor.

title: Usually the mosque is missed by tourists but archaeologically interesting site
review: Many people miss this place. Just stroll through crowded dark alleys that remind medieval Arab , Samarkand, Buhara, Istanbul . Come out of Dargah from its main gate and walk to your left. It is just 5-10 minutes walk from the Dargah towards the Taragarh fort . On your right side you find this place crowded mostly with Muslim pilgrims. It is a nice place for history lovers. You find the architecture interesting.Many believe that this mosque has been built at the place where a  Hindu mandir was and still Hindu architecture is visible. As I was not an expert, I was not able to make any conclusions. However, you will be amazed to see inside the mosque pillars that  are unique and  they differ from each other. Though it is a property of archaeological survey of  India, one cannot shed the feeling that the place is properly maintained. Those who are interested in archaeology and architecture are recommended to make a visit.

title: Great place. Must visit
review: Its a very nice place, quite and beautiful architecture. Picture perfect. Its said to be built by jinns in two and a half days! Interesting. Great Place. Thanks

title: not worth the hype.
review: this adhai din ka jhopra is definately not built in 2.5 days and it is soooo badly maintained with very dirty surroundings that i regretted coming here

title: A bit of a tatty ruin - but a great atmosphere
review: The mosque is a ruin - and rather tatty at that

title: A Somewhat Atmospheric Ruin
review: This mosque deserves a little loving attention. After all, here we have a construction dating back to 1198 when Islam was really just getting its first toehold in India. There are very few older Islamic buildings in the whole country- it is of approximately the same age as Qutb Minar in Delhi. The stone calligraphy on the seven outer arches is very fine and crisp, despite 800 years having past, and the Hindu-style pillar hall behind is also well-preserved, showcasing early Hindu temple design in Rajahstan.

title: nothing much to see
review: Nothing much to see in this place. It is a damaged mosque which is halfly built. It was considered that the mosque was constructed in just 2 and half day so it was named as Adhai-din ka Jhonpra Mosque . You can see it as it is just at a distance of 10 minute walking from dargah shariff.

title: Nothing to see , some ruins of the past
review: Although People had already suggested but we though to have a look by our self and it was true. This place is nothing more than  remains of the past. I would suggest to take ot out of your list of visiting place in Ajmer.

title: Nice Place
review: Nice place to see in Ajmer, if you have only 1 hour than do visit this place, as it has a good history.

title: Unexpectedly nice place
review: It's a basic monument, but grand enough to make you wonder how on earth can such a stone structure be built in 2.5 days, as claimed. As the sky was beautiful, we got some good architectural and landscape photos at this place.

title: IT WAS BUILD IN TWO AND HALF DAY
review: This is an historical monument just 5 minutes walk from the Dargah of Khawaja Moinudiin Chisti, which was once  Hindu School.

title: Nice Place
review: It is actually a Masjid built by Qutub-ud-Din-Aibak, first Sultan of Delhi, in AD 1199 contemporary to the other one built at Qutub-Minar complex of Delhi known as Quwal-ul-Islam mosque (power of Islam). Sultan Iltutmish had subsequently beautified it in AD 1213 with a screen pierced by corbelled engrailed arches which appears in this country for the first time.  However, a large number of architectural members and sculptures of temples are lying inside the verandah of the complex for safety and security purposes by the department which shows the existence of a Hindu temple in its vicinity during circa 11th-12th Century AD. This mosque, built from the dismantled remains of temples, is known as Adhai-din-ka-Jhonpra possibly from the fact that a fair used to be held here for two and a half days.

title: Exquisite piece of architecture
review: If we go back to the history records, Adhai-din-ka-Jhonpra is a Masjid built by Qutub-ud-Din-Aibak, first Sultan of Delhi, in AD 1199 contemporary to the other one built at Qutub-Minar complex of Delhi known as Quwal-ul-Islam mosque (power of Islam). Sultan Iltutmish had subsequently beautified it in AD 1213 with a screen pierced by corbelled engrailed arches which appears in this country for the first time.  However, a large number of architectural members and sculptures of temples are lying inside the verandah of the complex for safety and security purposes by the department which shows the existence of a Hindu temple in its vicinity during circa 11th-12th Century AD. It’s an exquisite piece of architecture, with soaring domes, pillars and a beautiful arched screen, largely built from pieces of Jain and Hindu temples.

title: HIDDEN PLACES IN AJMER
review: This hidden secret is just 100 yards behind the actual Mosque of Moiuddin Salim Chisti Dargah of Ajmer.  The visitors and worshipers usually forget to take a look on this special strutucture which was the rest place of Moiuddin Salim Chisti.  The place is in the shape of an old structure and people usually take shelter here for a while to relax after visiting the Dargah.  One can feel the charm of Ajmer city while looking around from top of this unique place. I encourage every visitor to have a must visit to this place while at Ajmer.

title: Coverted in 21/2 days
review: A small walk from the famous Dargah through a crowded bajar, one will reach this monument. By local folklore it was a Jain temple once & was converted to a mosque during the period of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in a short span of two & half a day. Still some pillars have pictures similar to Hindu temples & here are Greek symbols also.

title: Dirty place!
review: Its just beyond the Ajmer Sharif Dargha and can be easily missed. Its near the gate number 10 of the Dargah.
